Make a case

something like this

item.description:
@samuraiblood2 wrote:

you can make another or use that one (never used that one cause i havent seen it :P) just make a case (near that one i suppose) like this one case object id: teleportToX = x coords; teleportToY = y coords; break; to make it so it looks as though its opening delete the object and readd another object at diffrent coords (you might wanna make a void that the case calls)

item.title: How to open a door that u can't open?
item.dc:creator: @jonaske jonaske
item.description:
@jonaske wrote:

so i posted already but it works with the tele code but i wan’t to open it
so when i press open the door it need to be go open and not just tele to other side of the door…

i found some codes with a door in lumby castle :

if ((objectX == 3231 && objectY == 3433) || (objectX == 3253 && objectY == 3431) || (objectX == 2719 && objectY == 9671) || (objectX == 2722 && objectY == 9671) || (objectX == 3109 && objectY == 3167) || (objectX == 3107 && objectY == 3162)) { face = -3; //South } else if ((objectX == 3234 && objectY == 3426) || (objectX == 3225 && objectY == 3293) || (objectX == 3230 && objectY == 3291) || (objectX == 3235 && objectY == 3406) || (objectX == 3276 && objectY == 3421) || (objectX == 3207 && objectY == 3210)) { face = -2; //East } else if ((objectX == 3233 && objectY == 3427) || (objectX == 3215 && objectY == 3225) || (objectX == 3207 && objectY == 3217) || (objectX == 3208 && objectY == 3211)) { face = -1; //North }//else = West (standard) ReplaceObject(objectX, objectY, (objectID - 1), face);

could sombody if this code i can open that door that u can’t ?
1536 = id 3215x 3225y

Read full topic
item.source: How to open a door that u can't open?
